newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares edge up at end on U.S. jobs data.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares edge up at end on U.S. jobs data.

text.p: The Stockholm bourse reversed losses on Friday to end at a high after stronger-than-expected U.S. August jobs data.
The bourse's general index rose 0.37 percent to 2,000.21 on turnover of 2.5 billion crowns. The market index broke a record set on June 6.
Brokers forecast buying interest now that the U.S. jobs data has been published and cyclical shares would likely be in focus, they said.
"If it doesn't slide in the United States, we will probably see a continued upturn next week," a broker said.

Blue-chips fell in the first few minutes after the figures were released but recovered quickly. Telecoms group Ericsson closed at 158.50, up 1.50 crowns, and drugs company Astra rose one crown to 278.50.
